Pre-Game Insights: Germany kick-off a new era on Saturday evening as they welcome Hungary in their opening clash of the UEFA Nations League.
Several of Germany’s senior stars stepped down from the national team after Euro 2024, so expect many new faces for Die Mannschaft.
Julian Nagelsmann has appointed Bayern Munich’s Joshua Kimmich as Germany captain and he is expected to start at right-back for the team.
Liverpool’s Dominik Szoboszlai is expected to wear the armband for Hungary.
Exciting striker Rolland Sallai is also expected to feature for the Hungarians.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany vs Hungary is the opening clash of the UEFA Nations League.
The two teams also met in the previous Nations League campaign, with Germany losing at home and earning a draw away.
Others: Jamal Musiala will be key for Germany
Dominik Szoboszlai makes Hungary tick when it comes to attacking transitions and set-piece opportunities.
While Hungary possesses some very experienced players compared to Germany, we believe the young stars of Die Mannschaft will prevail to kick off a new era in style.
